title: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor.
description: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor.
OB: Upon answering 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, double-clicking on the file in the navigator reopens it. However, repeating steps 1) and 2) and selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor results in a 15-second delay to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: Expect the 'Revert' operation to be as fast as or faster than the close and reopen process in the Java editor, providing a seamless and prompt restoration of the original file content.
SR:
1. Open a file in the Java editor.
2. Make changes to the file.
3. Trigger the 'do you want to save changes' dialog and answer 'no'.
4. Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
5. Repeat steps 1) and 2).
6. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor. Observe the 15-second delay in replacing the window contents.
